column4: Hi. Brand-new clean Ubuntu 12.04 install. How do I get 'nvidia-detector' to return something other than 'none'?
have you checked out restricted drivers ?
I've seen mention of Bumblebee, etc. Is that what you refer to?
bumblebee is for laptops that use 2 levels of graphics that uses 2 different graphics chips and drivers, is that your setup?
I'm not sure. I have purchased a laptop *specifically* for CUDA work I need to do, but am having trouble getting it set up...
look for additional drivers , dunno which desktop you're using so...
did you locate the additional drivers ?
It says "No proprietary drivers are in use on this system" and I can't do anything other than "Close".
so it's already installed if you followed that CUDA tutorial
which tutorial? The only Mattias linked doesn't work on 12.04 Do you mean the bumblebee tutorial?

your graphics card will run perfectly fine on 12.04 with the right driver ...this cuda app is merely an enhancement. You should really just get the proper graphics driver first , then if you want more fancy stuff run the cuda thing
OK, how do I get the right driver? I'm not sure about even that... :( But I *need* CUDA for a specific app I want to run.
oh ok , then I'll stop interfering ..didn't realize that  ,my apologies
